required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Pilot Study to Explore Performance and Efficacy of 18F-FES PET/CT in ER-positive Breast Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: 18F-fluoroestradiol (FES) is radioactive labeled estradiol, developed for in vivo visualization of estrogen receptor (ER) using positron emission tomography (PET). In this prospective study, 18F-FES PET/CT will be used to evaluate ER activity of metastatic disease and their potential sensitivity to endocrine therapy in ER-positive breast cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Standardized uptake value of 18F-FES in BC
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The max standard uptake value (SUVmax) was measured in the breast cancer lesions on 18F-FES PET/CT.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The number of target lesions was calculated by 18F-FES PET/CT.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The number of lesions detected by 18F-FES PET/CT was compared with 18F-FDG PET/CT.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate overall survival (OS) in patients receiving regimens containing endocrine therapy

arm_group.description: Inject 18F-FES and then perform PET/CT scan.

intervention.description: Patients with suspected metastatic ER-positive breast cancer underwent 18F-FES PET/CT after an injection of 185-222 MBq (5-6 mCi) 18F-FES to image lesions of metastatic breast cancer.
